dublin_core.dcvalue: The introduction of mobile electronic devices as opposed to paper forms in pediatric outreach programs of the New York University College of Dentistry is discussed Since 2007 students have been receiving training on how to operate a personal digital assistant PDA and use it in community outreach for non invasive oral facial screenings and patient education The shift from using paper forms to electronic media had a positive impact among the academic community as it resulted in saving time and reducing the possibility of data collection errors It may represent a significant improvement in data collection and patient education and it provides an opportunity to enhance research and quality assessment
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T16:30:05Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2012-02-20
The New York state dental journal
Use of mobile electronic devices as educational tool in pediatric community outreach.
